news.title: Samsung and Coinbase Partner to Boost Crypto Access for Galaxy Users
news.body: Samsung has teamed up with Coinbase, offering 75 million Galaxy phone users in the US three months of free Coinbase One membership. This strategic partnership not only enhances cryptocurrency management for users but also sets the stage for broader crypto adoption across mainstream mobile platforms.

news.title: European Central Bank Teams Up with Italian Tech for Digital Euro
news.body: The ECB is advancing its digital euro project by partnering with Almaviva and Fabrick to develop necessary apps and infrastructure. This initiative is pivotal in promoting financial inclusion, enhancing EU's monetary sovereignty, and reducing dependency on traditional cash systems.

news.title: Salesforce Hit by Major Cybersecurity Breach, Billions of Records at Risk
news.body: Hackers have reportedly stolen 1 billion records from Salesforce's cloud databases, posing a significant threat to data security. This incident underscores the critical need for enhanced security measures in cloud storage to protect corporate data against increasingly sophisticated cyber threats.

news.title: EU Launches New AI Strategy to Counter US and China Tech Dominance
news.body: The European Union is rolling out a new AI strategy to decrease its tech dependency on the US and China, aiming to fortify its digital sovereignty. This move is crucial for ensuring the EU remains competitive in the global tech arena and mitigates risks related to geopolitical tech weaponization.

news.title: Remitee Raises $20M to Expand Embedded Cross-Border Payment Services
news.body: Remitee has secured $20 million to enhance its embedded remittance services, enabling seamless integration of instant cross-border payments for banks, fintechs, and retailers. This expansion is set to revolutionize global payment efficiencies, making financial transactions more accessible and streamlined.

curiosity.text: Did you know that the first digital camera was invented in 1975 and weighed 8 pounds? It only captured black and white images at a resolution of 0.01 megapixels!
